page.title: 18LOCAL SCHOOLS
page.content: THE AREA HAS THREE SCHOOLS,TWO PRIMARY,(CHILDREN AGED 5 TO 11) AND ONE SECONDARY MODERN,(CHILDREN AGED 11 TO 16). ONE PRIMARY IS IN THE VILLAGE OF BILLINGHAY AND HAS APPROXIMATELY 170 CHILDREN AND IT ALSO TAKES THE CHILDREN FROM THE RECENTLY CLOSED PRIMARY SCHOOLS AT DOGDYKE AND SOUTH KYME. THE OTHER PRIMARY IS IN WALCOTT AND HAS APPROXIMATELY 40 CHILDREN. THE LAFFORD SECONDARY SCHOOL HAS APPROXIMATELY 300 ON ROLL AND TAKES CHILDREN FROM A WIDER AREA. A SELECTIVE SYSTEM OF EDUCATION OPERATES IN THIS AREA AND THE CHILDREN ARE ASSESSED AT ELEVEN YEARS OF AGE. AROUND 20% GO TO GRAMMAR SCHOOLS IN SLEAFORD AND THE OTHER 80% MAINLY GO TO THE LAFFORD SCHOOL.THE LAFFORD SCHOOL IS ALSO SITUATED IN THE VILLAGE OF BILLINGHAY.
